resources.string: Choose your preferred blood glucose measurement unit
Toggles decimal place in \'carbohydrates in meal\' entry field
Enter how many carbohydrates 1 unit of fast-acting insulin covers
Enter how many carbohydrates you consumed in your meal
Enter the total amount of insulin you intake in a day (both fast-acting and long-acting)
Enter your current blood glucose level
Enter your desired blood glucose level
Enter how much 1 unit of fast-acting insulin lowers your blood glucose level

Insulator is the quickest way to easily calculate insulin doses. Over the next few screens, you\'ll input all the data needed to calculate your doses.\n\nIf you\'re unsure about any of the information requested or terms used, please contact your doctor before using Insulator.

Insulator is now configured and ready to use!

Enter your current blood glucose level and how many carbohydrates you've consumed, and Insulator will calculate a dose based on the parameters provided.

Please remember: Insulator's suggestion should only be used as a guideline.
If you\'re unsure of either your carbohydrate or corrective factor, Insulator can give you suggestions.\n\nEnter your total daily dose below, and tap Save on the suggestions you\'re happy with.
